column4: I am having problems with Chromium-browser and google-chrome both crashing on Ubuntu 12.04. Error messages from the terminal are here http://pastebin.com/kmNwGLzj      I googled this problem and found these bugs https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/chromium-browser/+bug/949439     and     http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=101160         I now don't know if this is a problem with chromium, google-chrome, ubuntu.
I am running chromium-browser version 18.0.1025.151 (Developer Build 130497 Linux) Ubuntu 12.04
generally, an "undecided, incomplete' bug report is not a good source to go on
you also need to update your Chromium
Where did you get your updated chromium? I have installed all the updates from the ubuntu repo. Is there another repo I should add or did you build it from source?
when I installed chromium, it added the google repo, so it updates straight from google. how did you install your chromium?
From the ubuntu software centre. How did you install yours?
I installed mine from Software Center
hang on a sec
did you try sudo apt-get update?
sorry, I was wrong, I forgot that I went to chrome.google.com
try that, it should offer to add itself to the repos
after you choose the correct settings or w/e it should open up software center for you
I have the google repo from when I installed google chrome. I will check which version of google-chrome I have

I have google-chrome 18.0.1025.168 and I was already having this problem. I have added some more update settings to my software sources. I will check for more updates and see if anything offers to update.
I had a similar problem a couple days ago, but the most recent update seems to have fixed it. Could you give me a url that crashes so I can test it?
Its no particular url that crashes it. Sometimes it happens randomly. Usually its when I try to login to google services with multiple sign on.
ah, that is a scenario I can't test. The GFW generally makes things like that impossible
Update manager is now installing chromium 18.0.1025.168 so hopefully that might fix it
probably the same update I put on a couple days ago, let me know if it works
